File extends AbstractObject implements IdAble

A file.

Return the file's digest. The format of the digest is not guaranteed to be stable between releases of Dagger. It is guaranteed to be stable between invocations of the same Dagger engine.

search()

Searches for content matching the given regular expression or literal string.

public search(string $pattern[, bool|null $literal = false ][, bool|null $multiline = false ][, bool|null $dotall = false ][, bool|null $insensitive = false ][, bool|null $skipIgnored = false ][, bool|null $skipHidden = false ][, bool|null $filesOnly = false ][, int|null $limit = null ][, array<string|int, mixed>|null $paths = null ][, array<string|int, mixed>|null $globs = null ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

Uses Rust regex syntax; escape literal ., [, ], {, }, | with backslashes.

Parameters
$pattern : string
$literal : bool|null = false
$multiline : bool|null = false
$dotall : bool|null = false
$insensitive : bool|null = false
$skipIgnored : bool|null = false
$skipHidden : bool|null = false
$filesOnly : bool|null = false
$limit : int|null = null
$paths : array<string|int, mixed>|null = null
$globs : array<string|int, mixed>|null = null
Return values
array<string|int, mixed>

withReplaced()

Retrieves the file with content replaced with the given text.

public withReplaced(string $search, string $replacement[, bool|null $all = false ][, int|null $firstFrom = null ]) : File

If 'all' is true, all occurrences of the pattern will be replaced.

If 'firstAfter' is specified, only the first match starting at the specified line will be replaced.

If neither are specified, and there are multiple matches for the pattern, this will error.

If there are no matches for the pattern, this will error.

Parameters
$search : string
$replacement : string
$all : bool|null = false
$firstFrom : int|null = null
Return values
File
